hanzi-su-wiki:
炮

Значения

Пушка, хлопушка

Мнемоника

Огонь 火 "вырывается" из своей упаковки 包.

Варианты

砲

pào
cannon; Classifiers: 座 ; firecracker
пушка; Классификаторы: 座; фейерверк

bāo
to sauté; to fry; to dry by heating
тушить; жарить; сушить нагреванием

páo
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
для приготовления лечебных трав путем запекания или обжаривания (на сковороде)
rtega_mnemonic:
砲砲RS
炮炮		gun, cannon
  • device wrapped around 包 a stone 石, if a fire 火 is applied the cannon ejects the stone 石
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 包 indicates the sound; 火 (fire) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
大炮 [ dà pào ]: big gun; cannon; artillery; one who talks big; trad. form 大炮 also used; Classifiers: 门
鞭炮 [ biān pào ]: firecrackers; string of small firecrackers; Classifiers: 枚
炮兵 [ pào bīng ]: artillery soldier; gunner
炮弹 [ pào dàn ]: artillery shell; Classifiers: 枚
炮火 [ pào huǒ ]: artillery barrage; gunfire
炮制 [ páo zhì ]: to concoct; to invent; to fabricate; to produce; to process; processing and curing (Chinese medicine)
如法炮制 [ rú fǎ páo zhì ]: lit. to follow the recipe (idiom); fig. to follow a set pattern
炮烙 [ páo lào ]: the hot pillar (ancient Chinese torture instrument)
炮炼 [ páo liàn ]: to parch and refine medicinal herbs
授意炮制 [ shòu yì páo zhì ]: to instruct sb. in concocting (sth.) (idiom)

• ⿰ Left to right

    • 包 [ bāo ] wrap, pack, bundle; package
heisig_chinese_memo: A cannon wraps a massive ball and shoots out like fireworks.
Ru_trainchinese:
pào: (сущ) орудие, пушка; (шахм.) пушка; хлопушка, петарда; взрывная скважина, заполненная динамитом
bāo: (глаг) (метод приготовления пищи) быстро обжаривать; (диал.) сушить (горячим способом)
páo: (глаг) (кит. мед.) готовить (лекарство из трав) путем жарки в кастрюле; (книжн.) жарить (пищу)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A cannon wraps a massive ball and shoots out like fireworks.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " fire " to " bag " sound. " Cannon " is a cooking method, which refers to putting hairy meat on a fire and grilling. "Shuowen": "Cannon, the hair burns the meat. From the fire, the sound is wrapped." Duan Yucai's note: "The hair burns the meat, which means that the meat does not remove the hair." Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Wu Ye": "There is a rabbit head, the fire of a cannon?" Kong Yingdashu: "Combine the hair and cannon it." When it comes to " Cannon " is to wrap the mud and burn it with fire. "Guang Yun. "Dao Yun": "Cannon, combined with hair burned objects, one is to wrap things and burn." Such as "Book of Rites. Li Yun": "Burn with cannon, burn with prosperity." Zheng Xuan's note: "Cannon is burnt."

" Cannon " by extension refers to general barbecue. "Jade articles. "Fire Department": "Cannon, grilled meat." For example, "Fun Tongyi. Emperor Ba. "Three Emperors" quoted "Li Han Wen Jia": "The Sui people began to drill wood to get fire, and the artillery was born into a familiarity. It makes people suffer from abdomen sickness. It is different from the beasts and the meaning of heaven, so it is called Sui Ren." . Yang Ziyou "Report to Sun Huizong": "The Tian family worked hard, and when he was old, he cooked lambs and pao lambs, fighting wine and doing his own work."

" Cannon " also refers to incineration. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The twenty-eighth year of Zhaogong": "Ling the emperor fire the gun, and destroy the clan party of the Que clan." According to legend, the torture used by the king of Shang Zhou was "paoluo". " Ge " refers to a copper pillar, which means that the tortured person can walk on a hot " ge " and fall into the fire at every turn to die. "The Biography of Ancient Lies. Nie Chuan. "Yin Yu Daji": "The people resent, and the princes have the bank, the prince is the method of artillery, the copper pillar is anointed, and the charcoal is added, so that the guilty can do it, and fall into the charcoal, Daji laughs."

" Pao " is one of the preparation methods of Chinese medicine, which means the use of fire to process Chinese herbal medicines to enhance the effectiveness of the medicine, reduce the toxicity of the medicine or facilitate storage. Such as the Southern Song Dynasty Hong Mai "Rongzhai Four Pens. Volume Three: "Anyone who coughs up against the rebellion, Tianxiong fires a gun, and uses wine to make a dagger." "Yuan Dian Zhang. Ministry of officials six. Confucianism: "It is very hot and poisonous, and it can be used as medicine." The idiom "made in the same way" originally refers to making traditional Chinese medicine according to the established method, and then metaphorically following it in accordance with the existing model.

" Cannon " pass for " kitchen ", expressed chef. Such as "Han Feizi. "The inner reserve said the next six micro": "The artillery called the sky and said: "Hey! The minister has three sins, die without knowing it!" "Han Feizi. Difficulty Two": "Anyone who is a man and a minister is still a prince who can dominate and advancing through the five flavors, and the emperor who eats, who dares to be strong?"

" Cannon " and " Cannon " have nothing to do with each other. " Cannon " was a machine used to launch stone bullets in ancient times. Later, because gunpowder was applied to the cannon, " cannon " was written as " cannon ". Such as Zhao Yi in the Qing Dynasty "Gai Yu Cong Kao. Artillery Guns: "The so-called gunners all use machines to fire stones." Chapter 16 of "Shuo Yue Quan Biography": "Ambush artillery is set up everywhere in Sanshan Pass at critical passes."

" Cannon " also means firecrackers. For example, "The Scholars" Chapter 29: "I saw the old monk slowly walk in, holding a brocade box in his hand, opening it, and showing a bunch of small Qimen firecrackers inside." Chapter 54 of "A Dream of Red Mansions": "Outside Cannon Zhang Lihu, pay attention to the fire paper hanging from the sky to burn it."

In modern times, the cooking method of rapid stir-frying is also called " pao ", such as "pao mutton" and "pao pork belly".
humanum_short_description_en: From " fire " to " bag " sound. " Cannon " is a cooking method, which refers to putting the hairy meat on the fire and grilling it. In other words, the mud is wrapped and then burned on the fire.
humanum_full_description:
從「火」，「包」聲。「炮」是一種烹調方法，指把連毛的肉放到火上燒烤。《說文》：「炮，毛炙肉也。从火，包聲。」段玉裁注：「毛炙肉，謂肉不去毛炙之也。」如《詩．小雅．瓠葉》：「有兔斯首，炮之燔之？」孔穎達疏：「並毛而炮之。」一說「炮」是把泥包裹在外再用火燒。《廣韻．肴韻》：「炮，合毛炙物也，一曰裹物燒。」如《禮記．禮運》：「以炮以燔，以亨以炙。」鄭玄注：「炮，裹燒之也。」

　　「炮」引申泛指一般的燒烤。《玉篇．火部》：「炮，炙肉也。」如《風俗通義．皇霸．三皇》引《禮含文嘉》：「燧人始鑽木取火，炮生為熟，令人無復腹疾，有異於禽獸，遂天之意，故曰遂人也。」《文選．楊子幼〈報孫會宗書〉》：「田家作苦，歲時伏臘，烹羊炮羔，斗酒自勞。」

　　「炮」亦指焚燒。如《左傳．昭公二十八年》：「令君炮之，盡滅郤氏之族黨。」相傳商紂王所用的酷刑「炮烙」，本作「炮格」。「格」指銅柱，意謂讓受刑者行走於燒紅發熱的「格」上，動輒墮入火中燒死。《古列女傳．孽嬖傳．殷紂妲己》：「百姓怨望，諸侯有畔者，紂乃為炮格之法，膏銅柱，加之炭，令有罪者行其上，輒墮炭中，妲己乃笑。」

　　「炮」是中藥的製法之一，意謂用火對中草藥進行加工，以加強藥物的效用、減低藥物的毒性或方便貯藏。如南宋洪邁《容齋四筆．卷三》：「咳逆者，天雄炮過，以酒調一錢匕服。」《元典章．吏部六．儒吏》：「其性大熱有毒，依方炮製可以入藥。」成語「如法炮製」本指依照成法製作中藥，後比喻按照已有的模式跟著做。

　　「炮」通作「庖」，表示廚師。如《韓非子．內儲說下六微》：「炮人呼天曰：『嗟乎！臣有三罪，死而不自知乎！』」《韓非子．難二》：「凡為人臣者，猶炮宰和五味而進之君，君弗食，孰敢強之也？」

　　「炮」和「砲」本來無關。「砲」是古代用來發射石彈的機器，後來因為火藥應用到砲上，「砲」又被寫作「炮」。如清代趙翼《陔餘叢考．火炮火槍》：「至所謂炮者，則皆以機發石。」《說岳全傳》第16回：「在三山口各處緊要關隘，遍設伏兵火炮。」

　　「炮」還表示爆竹。如《儒林外史》第29回：「只見老和尚慢慢走進來，手裡拏著一個錦盒子，打開來，裡面拏出一串祁門小炮仗。」《紅樓夢》第54回：「外頭炮張利害，留神天上弔下火紙來燒着。」

　　現代也把猛火快炒的烹調方法稱為「炮」，如「炮羊肉」、「炮豬肚」等。
humanum_short_description: 從「火」，「包」聲。「炮」是一種烹調方法，指把連毛的肉放到火上燒烤，一說把泥包裹在外再用火燒。

炮炮 		gun, cannon
  • device wrapped around 包 a stone 石, if a fire 火 is applied the cannon ejects the stone 石
Pictophonetic: 包 indicates the sound; 火 (fire) conveys the meaning.
  • Chinese Definition:
  • Chinese Definition:
  • Chinese Definition:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 火 [ huǒ ] fire, flame; to burn; anger, rage
    • 包 [ bāo ] wrap, pack, bundle; package
①重型武器的一类，有迫击炮、高射炮、火箭炮等：炮兵。炮弹。
②爆竹：鞭炮。花炮。
③爆破土石等在凿的眼内装进炸药后称“炮”。
炮兵 [ pào bīng ]: artillery soldier; gunner
炮弹 [ pào dàn ]: artillery shell; Classifiers: 枚
炮火 [ pào huǒ ]: artillery barrage; gunfire
①把物品放在器物上烘烤或焙：把湿衣服搁在热炕上炮干。
②一种烹调方法，在旺火上急炒：炮羊肉。
①烧：炮炙。炮烙。炮制。
炮制 [ páo zhì ]: to concoct; to invent; to fabricate; to produce; to process; processing and curing (Chinese medicine)
炮烙 [ páo lào ]: the hot pillar (ancient Chinese torture instrument)
炮炼 [ páo liàn ]: to parch and refine medicinal herbs
Pictophonetic: 包 indicates the sound; 火 (fire) conveys the meaning.

Story: A cannon wraps a massive ball and shoots out like fireworks.
Kind: both

從「 火 」，「 包 」聲。「 炮 」是一種烹調方法，指把連毛的肉放到火上燒烤。《說文》：「炮，毛炙肉也。从火，包聲。」段玉裁注：「毛炙肉，謂肉不去毛炙之也。」如《詩．小雅．瓠葉》：「有兔斯首，炮之燔之？」孔穎達疏：「並毛而炮之。」一說「 炮 」是把泥包裹在外再用火燒。《廣韻．肴韻》：「炮，合毛炙物也，一曰裹物燒。」如《禮記．禮運》：「以炮以燔，以亨以炙。」鄭玄注：「炮，裹燒之也。」 「 炮 」引申泛指一般的燒烤。《玉篇．火部》：「炮，炙肉也。」如《風俗通義．皇霸．三皇》引《禮含文嘉》：「燧人始鑽木取火，炮生為熟，令人無復腹疾，有異於禽獸，遂天之意，故曰遂人也。」《文選．楊子幼〈報孫會宗書〉》：「田家作苦，歲時伏臘，烹羊炮羔，斗酒自勞。」 「 炮 」亦指焚燒。如《左傳．昭公二十八年》：「令君炮之，盡滅郤氏之族黨。」相傳商紂王所用的酷刑「炮烙」，本作「炮格」。「 格 」指銅柱，意謂讓受刑者行走於燒紅發熱的「 格 」上，動輒墮入火中燒死。《古列女傳．孽嬖傳．殷紂妲己》：「百姓怨望，諸侯有畔者，紂乃為炮格之法，膏銅柱，加之炭，令有罪者行其上，輒墮炭中，妲己乃笑。」 「 炮 」是中藥的製法之一，意謂用火對中草藥進行加工，以加強藥物的效用、減低藥物的毒性或方便貯藏。如南宋洪邁《容齋四筆．卷三》：「咳逆者，天雄炮過，以酒調一錢匕服。」《元典章．吏部六．儒吏》：「其性大熱有毒，依方炮製可以入藥。」成語「如法炮製」本指依照成法製作中藥，後比喻按照已有的模式跟著做。 「 炮 」通作「 庖 」，表示廚師。如《韓非子．內儲說下六微》：「炮人呼天曰：『嗟乎！臣有三罪，死而不自知乎！』」《韓非子．難二》：「凡為人臣者，猶炮宰和五味而進之君，君弗食，孰敢強之也？」 「 炮 」和「 砲 」本來無關。「 砲 」是古代用來發射石彈的機器，後來因為火藥應用到砲上，「 砲 」又被寫作「 炮 」。如清代趙翼《陔餘叢考．火炮火槍》：「至所謂炮者，則皆以機發石。」《說岳全傳》第16回：「在三山口各處緊要關隘，遍設伏兵火炮。」 「 炮 」還表示爆竹。如《儒林外史》第29回：「只見老和尚慢慢走進來，手裡拏著一個錦盒子，打開來，裡面拏出一串祁門小炮仗。」《紅樓夢》第54回：「外頭炮張利害，留神天上弔下火紙來燒着。」 現代也把猛火快炒的烹調方法稱為「 炮 」，如「炮羊肉」、「炮豬肚」等。
From " fire" to " bag" sound. " Cannon" is a cooking method, which refers to putting hairy meat on a fire and grilling. "Shuowen": "Cannon, the hair burns the meat. From the fire, the sound is wrapped." Duan Yucai's note: "The hair burns the meat, which means that the meat does not remove the hair." Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Wu Ye": "There is a rabbit head, the fire of a cannon?" Kong Yingdashu: "Combine the hair and cannon it." When it comes to " Cannon" is to wrap the mud and burn it with fire. "Guang Yun. "Dao Yun": "Cannon, combined with hair burned objects, one is to wrap things and burn." Such as "Book of Rites. Li Yun": "Burn with cannon, burn with prosperity." Zheng Xuan's note: "Cannon is burnt." " Cannon" by extension refers to general barbecue. "Jade articles. "Fire Department": "Cannon, grilled meat." For example, "Fun Tongyi. Emperor Ba. "Three Emperors" quoted "Li Han Wen Jia": "The Sui people began to drill wood to get fire, and the artillery was born into a familiarity. It makes people suffer from abdomen sickness. It is different from the beasts and the meaning of heaven, so it is called Sui Ren." . Yang Ziyou "Report to Sun Huizong": "The Tian family worked hard, and when he was old, he cooked lambs and pao lambs, fighting wine and doing his own work." " Cannon" also refers to incineration. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The twenty-eighth year of Zhaogong": "Ling the emperor fire the gun, and destroy the clan party of the Que clan." According to legend, the torture used by the king of Shang Zhou was "paoluo". " Ge" refers to a copper pillar, which means that the tortured person can walk on a hot " ge" and fall into the fire at every turn to die. "The Biography of Ancient Lies. Nie Chuan. "Yin Yu Daji": "The people resent, and the princes have the bank, the prince is the method of artillery, the copper pillar is anointed, and the charcoal is added, so that the guilty can do it, and fall into the charcoal, Daji laughs." " Pao" is one of the preparation methods of Chinese medicine, which means the use of fire to process Chinese herbal medicines to enhance the effectiveness of the medicine, reduce the toxicity of the medicine or facilitate storage. Such as the Southern Song Dynasty Hong Mai "Rongzhai Four Pens. Volume Three: "Anyone who coughs up against the rebellion, Tianxiong fires a gun, and uses wine to make a dagger." "Yuan Dian Zhang. Ministry of officials six. Confucianism: "It is very hot and poisonous, and it can be used as medicine." The idiom "made in the same way" originally refers to making traditional Chinese medicine according to the established method, and then metaphorically following it in accordance with the existing model. " Cannon" pass for " kitchen", expressed chef. Such as "Han Feizi. "The inner reserve said the next six micro": "The artillery called the sky and said: "Hey! The minister has three sins, die without knowing it!" "Han Feizi. Difficulty Two": "Anyone who is a man and a minister is still a prince who can dominate and advancing through the five flavors, and the emperor who eats, who dares to be strong?" " Cannon" and " Cannon" have nothing to do with each other. " Cannon" was a machine used to launch stone bullets in ancient times. Later, because gunpowder was applied to the cannon, " cannon" was written as " cannon". Such as Zhao Yi in the Qing Dynasty "Gai Yu Cong Kao. Artillery Guns: "The so-called gunners all use machines to fire stones." Chapter 16 of "Shuo Yue Quan Biography": "Ambush artillery is set up everywhere in Sanshan Pass at critical passes." " Cannon" also means firecrackers. For example, "The Scholars" Chapter 29: "I saw the old monk slowly walk in, holding a brocade box in his hand, opening it, and showing a bunch of small Qimen firecrackers inside." Chapter 54 of "A Dream of Red Mansions": "Outside Cannon Zhang Lihu, pay attention to the fire paper hanging from the sky to burn it." In modern times, the cooking method of rapid stir-frying is also called " pao", such as "pao mutton" and "pao pork belly".

炮字的基本解释

炮
páo
烧：炮炙。炮烙（lu?）。炮制。

炮
bāo
把物品放在器物上烘烤或焙：把湿衣服搁在热炕上炮干。
一种烹调方法，在旺火上急炒：炮羊肉。

炮
pào
重型武器的一类，有迫击炮、高射炮、火箭炮等：炮兵。炮弹。
爆竹：鞭炮。花炮。
爆破土石等在凿的眼内装进炸药后称“炮”。

在旺火上速炒。一类重型武器的统称。

Name meaning
Quickly stir fry on the hot fire. A collective term for a class of heavy weapons.
pào, bāo, páo
I гл.
1) páo вываривать; прожаривать (один из способов приготовления лекарств китайской медицины)
2) páo книжн. жарить, жечь
炮之 зажарить, испечь (что-л.)
毛炮 обжигать (опаливать) шерсть
3) bāo жарить; поджаривать (мясо)
炮肉 жарить мясо
炮一盘儿羊肚 поджаривать тарелку бараньих рубцов
4) bāo сушить, просушивать (на огне)
II сущ.
1) pào оружие калибром свыше 20 мм; огнестрельное орудие, пушка; артиллерия, артиллерийский
2) pào (сокр. вм. 炮仗) хлопушка, ракета, петарда
3) pào пао, пушка (фигура в китайских шахматах, ходит как 车 jū, бьёт только через фигуру)
4) páo вм. 庖 (кухня; повар)
